definition: time of death/limited to a fixed period of time/fixed term
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Radiocarbon dating showed that the head's age matched the king's date of death.
sentences.chinese: 放射性碳顯示這個頭顱的年齡符合國王的死期。

sentences.english: To-day is the festival of phantoms that know not when they die.
sentences.chinese: 本日是幻影的節日，他們不知道本身的死期。

sentences.english: There are few situations more horrible than having to tell another human being that he or she is going to die.
sentences.chinese: 其實沒什麼事會比告知某人死期將至更可怕了。

sentences.english: The day of him who shall die in a robe of silver has not yet come.
sentences.chinese: 那身着銀袍，必死於人前之人的死期未到。

sentences.english: When the time drew near for David to die, he gave a charge to Solomon his son.
sentences.chinese: 大衛的死期臨近了，就囑咐他兒子所羅門說。

sentences.english: Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying.
sentences.chinese: 大衛的死期臨近了，就囑吩他兒子所羅門說。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
same as 閻羅王|阎罗王/Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
see 一命嗚呼|一命呜呼[yi1 ming4 wu1 hu1]
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
Facebook (Internet slang, pun reading "you must die")
